Warm-up (2-3 min)

na with tense review:

I didn't go (past) → ?
It's not true that I will eat → ?

(Answers: mi pu na klama, mi na ba citka)

New Material (5-7 min)

Scalar Negation

Unlike na (which negates the whole bridi), these negate just the selbri on a scale:

na'e — Other Than

mi na'e klama

I other-than-go. (I do something else, not specified.)

to'e — Polar Opposite

ti to'e melbi

This is the opposite of beautiful. (= ugly)

ti to'e xamgu

This is the opposite of good. (= bad)

no'e — Neutral Midpoint

ti no'e melbi

This is neither beautiful nor ugly. (neutral)

The Scale

to'e ←——— no'e ———→ [positive]
opposite   neutral    affirmed
Cmavo Position Example
to'e Opposite extreme to'e xamgu (bad)
no'e Middle/neutral no'e melbi (plain)
na'e Other than na'e klama (not-going)
(none) Affirmed melbi (beautiful)

Key Point

na'e = other than, to'e = opposite, no'e = neutral. These modify the selbri, not the whole bridi.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Opposites with to'e

Create opposites:

  1. beautiful → ugly
  2. good → bad
  3. big → tiny
Answers
  1. to'e melbi
  2. to'e xamgu
  3. to'e barda

Exercise 2: Neutral with no'e

Create neutral forms:

  1. neither beautiful nor ugly → ?
  2. neither good nor bad → ?
  3. neither big nor small → ?
Answers
  1. no'e melbi
  2. no'e xamgu
  3. no'e barda

Exercise 3: Other-than with na'e

Translate:

  1. I do something other than go. → ?
  2. I feel something other than happy. → ?
  3. This is something other than a dog. → ?
Answers
  1. mi na'e klama
  2. mi na'e gleki
  3. ti na'e gerku

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "This is ugly." → ti to'e melbi
  2. "This is neither good nor bad." → ti no'e xamgu
  3. "I do something else." → mi na'e zukte

Summary

You learned scalar negation: na'e (other than), to'e (polar opposite), no'e (neutral midpoint).
